Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Physical Activity Intervention in Colorectal Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised, controlled, open-label, multicenter trial was conducted in six hospitals in Sweden.

Participants.evidence: Participants aged ≥20 years scheduled for elective colorectal cancer surgery were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to either a physical activity intervention or usual care.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the effect of a short-term, unsupervised exercise intervention on self-assessed physical recovery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was self-assessed physical recovery 4 weeks postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded, while participants and clinicians were informed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between January 22, 2015, and May 28, 2020, 761 participants were randomised (intervention: 379, control: 382).

Number_Analysed.evidence: After exclusions, 668 participants (intervention: 317, control: 351) were analysed using intention-to-treat.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention showed no effect on the primary outcome (adjusted odds ratio 0.84, 95% CI 0.62–1.15), with 13% and 15% of participants feeling fully physically recovered in the intervention and control groups, respectively.
